snippet: In 1956, Harvard declined an invitation to play in Louisiana because of a segregationist law, but this year, the Crimson’s goal is to make a trip to the Final Four in New Orleans.
abstract: Harvard men's basketball team, appearing in the NCAA tournament for the first time in 66 years, is hoping to get to the Final Four in New Orleans; in 1956, the team declined an invitation to play in Louisiana because of a segregationist law.
lead_paragraph: In 1956, Harvard declined an invitation to play in Louisiana because of a segregationist law, but this year, the Crimson’s goal is to make a trip to the Final Four in New Orleans.

headline.seo: In 1956, a Racial Law Soured Harvard on a Trip to New Orleans
headline.main: In 1956, a Racial Law Repelled Harvard’s Team
